name: places/ChIJVS0B47lZwokRIJ5gaQZFQPU
formattedAddress: 415 W 24th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
adrFormatAddress: 415 W 24th St, New York, NY 10011, USA

originalText.text: I do not recommend working with this Shelter.. As much as all these lovely furry friends need a home the women behind the scenes is not worth the heartache. We were approved to meet and adopt a new guy when the “emails got crossed” and the dog was adopted. It took me emailing multiple times just to get this news. Jessica is a sweet heart, she really tried her hardest to help us on the journey but whom ever is in charge, doesn’t seem to have the common courtesy to write out emails and let people know of the situation in its entirety.

text.text: I do not recommend working with this Shelter.. As much as all these lovely furry friends need a home the women behind the scenes is not worth the heartache. We were approved to meet and adopt a new guy when the “emails got crossed” and the dog was adopted. It took me emailing multiple times just to get this news. Jessica is a sweet heart, she really tried her hardest to help us on the journey but whom ever is in charge, doesn’t seem to have the common courtesy to write out emails and let people know of the situation in its entirety.

originalText.text:
We took a dog based on their description and  within two days I was bitten six times and my husband twice.My hand got infected and required a dr and meds  When I saw the assessment from the shelter, he was described as anxious, biter and not to be with children. We told rescue we had young grands and that didn’t seem to matter. To make it worse, the dog was a New Hope, free to the rescue with all vetting done. They charged us $500 for him. I strongly recommend staying away from these people.

Photos of both hands, bloody and bruised

originalText.text: Do not use this rescue to foster a dog. She was 0 help and tried not to pay for the vet bills. She made little to no effort to help get our foster dog adopted; we still have him a year later and all she is worried about is her adoption fee. $500 for a dog from a kill shelter...

text.text: Do not use this rescue to foster a dog. She was 0 help and tried not to pay for the vet bills. She made little to no effort to help get our foster dog adopted; we still have him a year later and all she is worried about is her adoption fee. $500 for a dog from a kill shelter...

originalText.text: Working with Pound Hounds has been one of the most rewarding things I have done besides my children and caring for the elderly!  I started out fostering a dog 3 years ago named Luna  and she was just the perfect dog.  I was amazed at how well Donna had paired up this dog with my family.  She ended up being a great nanny dog which my children absolutely love!  We had to adopt her and she will stay with us furever. Since Donna was so great to work with we decided to continue to have one foster after we adopted Luna. If the dogs ever need anything from vetting to training Donna is always there to make sure the dogs come first!

originalText.text: The absolute best! The support I have gotten from Donna has been incredible. Here is a pic of Tua for perspective.
